Module com.ning.breakout
Package com.ning.breakout.view.graphics

Class Brick

java.lang.Object
com.ning.breakout.view.graphics.Brick
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClayBrick, CrackedBrick, SteelBrick
public abstract class Brick extends Object
Brick is the abstract base class for all brick classes which defines the common attributes and behaviors of all brick classes.

The layout of the view of the brick binds with the model of the brick. By adding the view of the brick into container, the brick could be displayed onto the stage.

By extending the abstract class Brick, sub-classes could introduce new features like making cracks on brick after impact or ignoring the impact.

Author:
Ning ZHU - modified

    Brick(BrickModel model, int strength, javafx.scene.Group group)
    The class constructor sets the model and the view container of the brick, binds the layout of the view of the brick with the model, adds the view to the container, and specifies the number of effective impacts that the brick can withstand in total.

    • Brick

      public Brick(BrickModel model, int strength, javafx.scene.Group group)
      The class constructor sets the model and the view container of the brick, binds the layout of the view of the brick with the model, adds the view to the container, and specifies the number of effective impacts that the brick can withstand in total. 
       
  Modified from the original source code:
  public Brick(String name, Point pos,Dimension size,Color border,
  Color inner,int strength){
      rnd = new Random();
      broken = false;
      this.name = name;
      brickFace = makeBrickFace(pos,size);
      this.border = border;
      this.inner = inner;
      this.fullStrength = this.strength = strength;
  }
      Parameters:
      model - the model of brick
      strength - the number of effective impacts the brick can withstand in total
      group - the container of brick's view
      See Also:

    • getBrickView

      public javafx.scene.image.ImageView getBrickView()
      Returns the view of the brick.

      The layout of the ImageView object binds with the model of the brick. By setting the source image of the ImageView object and adding it to the container, different bricks can be displayed onto the screen.

      Returns:
      the view of the brick
      See Also:
      • ImageView

    • isBroken

      public boolean isBroken()
      Returns the broken status of the brick.

      The brick will be set to broken when the current strength of the brick drops to 0.

      Returns:
      true if the brick is broken

    • getScore

      public int getScore()
      Returns 0 if the brick is not broken, otherwise the specified score for breaking the brick.
      Returns:
      0 or the specified score for breaking the brick

    • setBroken

      public void setBroken(boolean isBroken)
      Sets the broken status of the brick.

      Sets to true only if the current strength of the brick drops to 0, otherwise false.

      Parameters:
      isBroken - the broken status of the brick

    • setScore

      public void setScore(int score)
      Sets the score of the brick.

      Sets to 0 if the brick is not broken and sets to the specified score if the brick is broken. (The score varies in different brick classes)

      Parameters:
      score - 0 or the specified score for breaking the brick

    • impact

      public void impact()
      Simulates impact on brick.

      After impact, the current strength of the brick should minus itself by one and if the current strength drops to 0, sets the broken status of the brick to true (broken). 

       
  Modified from the original source code:
  public void impact(){
      strength--;
      broken = (strength == 0);
  }

    • setImpact

      public boolean setImpact(javafx.geometry.Point2D point, int dir)
      Sets impact on brick.

      This method is used for brick classes which do not have cracks and cannot ignore impact.

      If the brick is broken after impact, the view of the brick will be removed from the container (screen), and the score of the brick will be set from 0 to the specified score (equals to the full strength of the brick) for breaking it.

      Notes that arguments are not used here, but for method overriding, these arguments are needed. 

       
  Modified from the original source code:
  public boolean setImpact(Point2D point, int dir){
      if(broken)
          return false;
      impact();
      return broken;
  }
      Parameters:
      point - the point where the ball impacts the brick
      dir - the impact direction
      Returns:
      the broken status of the brick after impact

    • findImpact

      public int findImpact(Ball ball)
      Finds the direction where the ball impacts the brick.

      Broken brick cannot be impacted, just returns 0. For brick not broken, returns 0 if no impact found, otherwise returns the number which indicates the impact direction.

      Determines the impact direction based on the position of the feature points of the ball, the moving direction of the ball and the layout of the brick's view (checks whether points within the view of the brick). 

       
  Modified from the original source code:
  public final int findImpact(Ball b){
      if(broken)
          return 0;
      int out  = 0;
      if(brickFace.contains(b.right))
          out = LEFT_IMPACT;
      else if(brickFace.contains(b.left))
          out = RIGHT_IMPACT;
      else if(brickFace.contains(b.up))
          out = DOWN_IMPACT;
      else if(brickFace.contains(b.down))
          out = UP_IMPACT;
      return out;
  }
      Parameters:
      ball - the instance of class Ball
      Returns:
      the impact direction

    • repair

      public void repair()
      Repairs the brick.

      This method is used for brick classes which do not have cracks.

      Sets the current strength to the full strength. If the brick is broken, additionally resets the score of brick to 0, the broken status of the brick to false and adds the view of the brick back to the container. 

       
  Modified from the original source code:
  public void repair() {
      broken = false;
      strength = fullStrength;
  }
